info.name: Heart Monitoring
info.description: A RESTful API to manage doctors, patients, and their heart rate data.

query.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

request.description:
API view for listing and creating heart rate records for a specific patient.
- Doctors can create/view heart rates for their patients.
- Patients can only view their own heart rate history.
- Supports filtering by date range.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

query.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

response.name: Example
response.body:
{
    "count": 3,
    "next": "http://localhost:8000/api/patients/?page=2",
    "previous": null,
    "results": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "full_name": "John Doe",
            "age": 45,
            "address": "123 Health St, Wellness City",
            "contact_number": "9876543210",
            "blood_group": "O+",
            "user": 4,
            "user_username": "bolu",
            "doctor": 3,
            "doctor_username": "shagun"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "full_name": "Suraj Patel",
            "age": 45,
            "address": "123 Health St, Wellness City",
            "contact_number": "9876543210",
            "blood_group": "O+",
            "user": 5,
            "user_username": "suraj",
            "doctor": 3,
            "doctor_username": "shagun"
        }
    ]
}

request.description:
Takes a refresh type JSON web token and returns an access type JSON web
token if the refresh token is valid.

Takes a set of user credentials and returns an access and refresh JSON web
token pair to prove the authentication of those credentials.
